channel.title: BBC News - Northern Ireland
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Public Health Agency to take over contact tracing in schools
item.description: Principals' representatives and teaching unions are expected to be consulted on the plan later.

item.title: Firmus energy: Gas prices rising by 35% in towns across NI
item.description: The Consumer Council says the average Firmus energy annual bill is set to rise by about £182.

item.title: Syrian refugees in NI 'trapped' in poverty and trauma
item.description: Healthcare access is described as "abysmal", while language barriers remained an ongoing problem.

item.title: County Kerry: Three people found dead with gunshot wounds
item.description: Gardaí (Irish police) say the bodies were discovered at property in north County Kerry.

item.title: Arlene Foster to step down as MLA by end of month
item.description: The former DUP leader says the process to pick her successor has already begun.

item.title: Donegal engineering firm to be sold for $2bn
item.description: E&I Engineering, founded by Derry City chairman Philip O'Doherty, is being sold to a US-based company.

item.title: Holy Cross dispute: The terror and the trauma recalled 20 years on
item.description: A teacher, priest and minister recall the dispute outside Holy Cross Primary School in Belfast in 2001.

item.title: Holy Cross: 'I was in the school and we heard an explosion'
item.description: Two decades on from the Holy Cross dispute some of those present remember the tension and fear.

item.title: Coronavirus: Schools overwhelmed by 'tsunami' of Covid absences
item.description: The Ulster Teachers' Union says schools do not have the capacity to maintain current mitigations.

item.title: Cancer nurse numbers short of care target, says charity
item.description: The proposal would give every cancer patient a nurse to support them through their journey.

item.title: Coronavirus: Assembly recalled over school Covid absences
item.description: There is concern the test and trace policy is causing a high number of pupils to miss classes.

item.title: The Open 2025: Royal Portrush named as host venue after successful return in 2019
item.description: Northern Ireland's Royal Portrush is named as the host venue of the Open Championship in 2025 later today.

item.title: What are Northern Ireland's Covid-19 rules now?
item.description: How do restrictions here compare to other parts of the UK and the Republic of Ireland?

item.title: Covid-19: Northern Ireland health system 'one step from chaos'
item.description: BBC News NI is given exclusive access to an intensive care unit, where patients are battling Covid.

item.title: Covid-19: Table service rules over for NI pubs and restaurants
item.description: Up to 15 people are now allowed indoors in homes while dancing will be allowed at wedding receptions.

item.title: Covid-19: Some schools 'not following pupils close contact advice'
item.description: A teachers' organisation says there are concerns the guidance could lead to more Covid cases.

item.title: Covid-19: Nisra records highest weekly death toll since February
item.description: Covid-19 is mentioned on the death certificates of 53 people in the week leading up to 27 August.

item.title: NI Covid-19 restrictions: Your questions answered
item.description: BBC News NI sets out the latest steps ministers are taking to ease Northern Ireland's lockdown.

item.title: Latest Northern Ireland weather forecast
item.description: The weather forecast in Northern Ireland.

item.title: NI health: Daily battle for beds as system 'on knife edge'
item.description: Too few staff and a lack of hospital beds contribute to a fragile health system, writes Marie-Louise Connolly.

item.title: Lagan College: Northern Ireland's oldest integrated school marks 40 years
item.description: Lagan College educates more than 1,400 pupils in the Castlereagh area of Belfast.

item.title: Holy Cross: Remembering a school run like no other
item.description: BBC News NI's Gareth Gordon reflects on the 20th anniversary of Belfast's Holy Cross school dispute.

item.title: 'I found out I had five siblings when I was 73'
item.description: One woman's quest to find out more about her grandmother led to five big discoveries for her father.

item.title: Universal Credit: 'I'm living hand-to-mouth'
item.description: Megan Potts from Bangor in County Down says she is already living "hand-to-mouth" on Universal Credit.

item.title: Covid-19: 'Without the vaccine we would have been on our knees'
item.description: BBC News NI is given access to Belfast City Hospital's intensive care unit, where a consultant warns the system is "one step from chaos".

item.title: Lagan College: The day the world's press came to a school picnic
item.description: Lagan College in Belfast first opened with 28 pupils in a scout centre in September 1981.

item.title: Dame Siobhan Keegan: 'It is important to see women in senior positions'
item.description: NI's first lady chief justice says it is an important day for women in the legal profession.

item.title: Rainbow crossing: NI's first rainbow crossing unveiled in Londonderry
item.description: It links the Guildhall to the Peace Bridge and aims to support the city's LGBTQ+ community.

item.title: Troubles legacy plans a whitewash, says victim's brother
item.description: The family of a 14-year-old girl killed in Derry speak out on the 50th anniversary of her death.

item.title: Pat Hume: Peacemaker was pure of heart, mourners told
item.description: Mourners gathered for the funeral of the peace campaigner and wife of politician John Hume.

item.title: Ballykelly: RAF flypast honours bomber crew 80 years on
item.description: Relatives of the airmen pay tribute to the Foyle College students who located the crash site.

item.title: Republic of Ireland 1-1 Serbia: Late own goal gives under-pressure Stephen Kenny his best result as manager
item.description: A late equaliser gives the Republic of Ireland their best result under Stephen Kenny as they draw with Serbia in World Cup qualifying.

item.title: Republic of Ireland to ban the sale of polluting solid fuels
item.description: The new rules, which will make Ireland a low-smoke zone, are expected to be in place within a year.

item.title: Coronavirus: Republic of Ireland eases gathering and wedding restrictions
item.description: Places of worship can operate at 50% capacity, while live music and dancing can resume at weddings.

item.title: HSE cyber-attack: Irish health service still recovering months after hack
item.description: Almost four months after a ransomware attack on the Irish health service, disruption remains.

item.title: World Cup qualifying: Late Duffy header saves Republic of Ireland from Azerbaijan defeat
item.description: Shane Duffy spares the Republic of Ireland's blushes with a late header to earn a World Cup qualifying draw with Azerbaijan in Dublin.

item.title: Irish Leaving Certificate grades up 2.4% on 2020
item.description: The increase is on top of a significant jump in results the year before.
